page.title: 12Bus services for Coniston
page.content: Most people own, or have access to, a {car.}They can easily get to{Ambleside (14km),{Ulverston}(24km) or further afield, even though the cost of{fuel (approximately 42p per litre) makes travelling expensive. But those who rely on{public transport}face greater expense per journey, and also much inconvenience. The village was served by a{railway (Foxfield - Coniston, via Broughton) until the early 1960's. Since then the {bus}has been the only public transport. There is a regular service between Ambleside and Ulverston, but only six buses a day in summer, less in winter. {Fares}are high, and always there are {cut-backs}in the service, partly because fewer and fewer people use the buses; a vicious spiral which seems to have no end.
